newsitem.title: USA: Norfolk says Conrail deal adds presence.
newsitem.headline: Norfolk says Conrail deal adds presence.

text.p: Norfolk Southern Corp said Thursday at its annual meeting that its planned acquisition of part of the Conrail system will give it a competitive presence in major ports and markets east of the Mississippi River.
The company also said the Conrail deal will enhance competition and improve service beyond the northeast, and encourage investment.

In March, a proposed $10.3 million cash transaction was announced in which Norfolk Southern will split the railroad's assets with rival bidder CSX Corp. The plan calls for Norfolk Southern to pay $5.9 billion for 58 percent of Conrail.
